remarks: In a domain, any nonzero element is a non-zero-divisor.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-Mar-2015.)
statement:
isdomn2.b $e |- B = ( Base ` R ) $.
isdomn2.t $e |- E = ( RLReg ` R ) $.
isdomn2.z $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` R ) $.
domnrrg $p |- ( ( R e. Domn /\ X e. B /\ X =/= .0. ) -> X e. E ) $.
